intro: Grammanthes flava, commonly known as the golden grammanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in dense, spike-like inflorescences. The plant belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Grammanthes flava typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its foliage consists of strap-shaped, evergreen leaves that remain throughout the year.
